control.ai
Class PlayerAssumption

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      control.ai.PlayerAssumption
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
public class PlayerAssumption
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.util.Observer

This class maintains the knowledge about hand cards of other players. It stores a list of certain and possible hand cards and notifies its observers whenever a new hand card is certainly derived. Observers are other instances of PlayerAssumption or the SearchSpace. The methods removePossibleCard() and addCertainCard() contain some simple hard-coded logic for direct conclusions (for example if all hand cards are known, there are no possible hand cards anymore).

See Also:
Player, removePossibleCard(Card), addCertainHandCard(Card), Observable

Method Detail

removePossibleCard

public void removePossibleCard(Card card)
                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Remove a card from the set of possible cards. If this set does not contain this card, do nothing. If after adding this card, we have as much possible cards as free player's hand card slots, add them to certainHandCards and remove them from possible hand cards.

Parameters:
card - card to remove
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if card is null

addCertainHandCard

public void addCertainHandCard(Card card)
                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Add a certain hand card. Assert that this card is a possible hand card. If after adding this card we have as much certain cards as player hand cards, remove all possible hand cards.

Parameters:
card -
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if card is null

addAnsweredSuggestion

public void addAnsweredSuggestion(Suggestion sugg)
                           throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Call this method when the subjected player answered a suggestion hidden from the AI player. It will add a suitable clause to the knowledge base if none of the cards in the suggestion are in the certain hand cards.

Parameters:
sugg - suggestion to add
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter is null or one of the card in the suggestion is null

update

public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
This method is called whenever a certain card is added somewhere else. We can then exclude this card from our possible cards pool.

Specified by:
update in interface java.util.Observer
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if arg is NULL
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if arg is not a Card
See Also:
Observer.update(java.util.Observable, java.lang.Object)

isFullyExplored

public boolean isFullyExplored()
Returns if this player is fully explored, meaning that we know each of his/her hand cards.

Returns:
TRUE if we know all hand cards, FALSE otherwise
